title: Champion wanted: BLAKE2b precompile

milestone.title: Istanbul: Hard deadline to accept proposals
milestone.description: EIPs need to be at least merged into Draft. With changes to EIP-233, ideally they should be PR'd into [Istanbul Hardfork Meta EIP 1679](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1679).

body:
From [ACD 60](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/95), looking for a champion for Blake2b precompile

* Issue (needs to be turned into a real EIP PR) https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/152
* @virgil supports this https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/blake2b-f-precompile/3157, use that thread for more discussion
@Souptacular is going to talk to @zooko about participating in this

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done
__This issue now has a funding of 300.0 DAI (300.0 USD @ $1.0/DAI) attached to it.__ * If you would like to work on this issue you can 'start work' [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955). * Want to chip in? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955). * Questions? Checkout Gitcoin Help or the Gitcoin Slack * $96,808.74 more funded OSS Work available on the [Gitcoin Issue Explorer](https://gitcoin.co/explorer)
I'd be curious to hear from a professional how long this might take, how much work it might be, and what sort of budget might be needed. Happy to reach out to a few folks.

It‚Äôs going to be work from now until October keeping on top of shepherding this forward. Call that 10 hours per week. 

Plus writing code, test cases, speed tests, and assisting different clients in implementation. 

And could be done as a precompile or as speeding up VM implementations. Speeding up VM implementations / adjusting gas costs is a bigger chunk of work but has larger pay off. 

In either case, call it one full time technical human plus average 10 hours per week on communications. 

For 4 - 5 months. So, $12.5K per month, $62.5K

Yes, this might take less than full time, so call this the upper bound.
Thanks Boris, this is helpful and seems reasonable. Very grateful to Gitcoin for initial funding here - we are now 0.5% of the way towards the goal :)

Want to chip in also? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955).
I can do it. I'd need a week to get caught up to speed.

Issue Status: 1. Open 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. **Done** 

<hr>

__Work has been started__.


These users each claimed they can complete the work by 1¬†week ago.
Please review their action plans below:


**1) [whiterabot17](https://gitcoin.co/whiterabot17) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=whiterabot17) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=whiterabot17))_.**

Step 1. Review criteria
Step 2. Communicate with developers on project about requirements.
Step 3. Review similar hash algorithm precompile code
Step 4. Code/Test
Step 5. Repeat steps 1-4.
**2) [madeoftin](https://gitcoin.co/madeoftin) has been approved to start work.**

The due date for Istanbul was last week so I reformatted and submitted the EIP. https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2024
Carterpy has also joined me on development. 

I can do the majority of the legwork in shepherding the EIP through the EIP process as well as be the point of contact for developers and the community.

The next steps are too:

* Re-implement the existing code
* Respond to the CoreDev feedback on design choices
* Finalize the specification 
* Bench-marking gas costs
* Second Client implementation
* Testing

I will continue to keep this moving forward until this EIP makes it into a Hardfork. There is still a chance it can make it into Istanbul as there is two months before the soft-deadline for client implementations.
**3) [srcoughlin](https://gitcoin.co/srcoughlin) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=srcoughlin) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=srcoughlin))_.**

I've followed the discussion on this in core devs meeting #62 and think I can champion this along.  It's going to need detailed performance metrics as the recently optimized EVM implementation already reduces the gas savings potential over when EIP 152 was originally created. This may also require consideration of heterogeneous computing optimizations.
This project can also act as a template for gas cost estimations and precompile savings estimations for other cryptographic hash functions.
**4) [mhluongo](https://gitcoin.co/mhluongo) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=mhluongo) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=mhluongo))_.**

We're working through the F precompile EIP (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2129) as well as the get implementation (https://github.com/keep-network/go-ethereum/pull/4)
**5) [prorokeskobar](https://gitcoin.co/prorokeskobar) has applied to start work _(Funders only: [approve worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=approve&worker=prorokeskobar) | [reject worker](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955?mutate_worker_action=reject&worker=prorokeskobar))_.**

Provide an action plan and any initial questions you have for this ticket.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955).

Is this still open @bmann @ceresstation?

I would love to throw my hat in the ring, I think I could write up an `Action Plan` that is quite compelling and deliver on it as well ‚ò∫Ô∏è
@mkosowsk Fill out the gitcoin form
@mkosowsk Me and @carterpy have been working on this. Are you interested in Coding for it? The next step is working on reference implementations.
Glad to see you all coordinating here. @MadeofTin @mkosowsk @carterpy @WhiteRaBot17 if you're all okay with working together on this and splitting the bounty we're happy to support that.

No problem @mkosowsk :)

@WhiteRaBot17 let me know how best to reach you. I left a message on Gitter for you
@MadeofTin @ceresstation I'd be happy to collaborate with others to push this through. Contacting @MadeofTin on gitter now.

üí∞ A crowdfund contribution worth 1.89000  ETH (499.56 USD @ $264.32/ETH) has been attached to this funded issue  from @virgil.üí∞ 

Want to chip in also? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955).

üí∞ A crowdfund contribution worth 17.00000  ETH (4544.78 USD @ $267.34/ETH) has been attached to this funded issue  from @virgil.üí∞ 

Want to chip in also? Add your own contribution [here](https://gitcoin.co/issue/ethereum-cat-herders/PM/64/2955).

Folks, @pdyraga and I (with support from the [Keep team](http://github.com/keep-network)) can champion this. We're in touch with @MadeofTin as well as @str4d and @zookozcash on the Zcash side. We're focused on an updated `F` EIP and `geth` implementation, first, then implementing @MadeofTin 's [open EIP](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/2024) that's specific to `blake2b`.

There are some open questions around the interface in the latter, and we know an `F` precompile will suffice for most use cases- thus the strategy.
